intro: Hieracium bellulum, commonly known as the small devil's-bit scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves and produces its flowers on slender, leafless stalks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its habitat.
